result.execSummary:
The defendant Brannon A Reid was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing April 1, 2016 and each 1st of the month thereafter until paid in full.  There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brannon A Reid

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Sent copy via email of JOC, Complaint & Plea Questionnaire to Wis Dept of Justice CIB per request recd 9-7-17

Def in person & by Atty Gary R Schmaus.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  No contest plea entered to Count 2,  Court dismissed Count 1 for read-in.  Court finds def guilty on Count 2 and orders fine of $642.00 to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 4-1-16  or judgment shall be entered for nonpayment.  There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.  Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.
Def in person & by Atty Gary R Schmaus.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Victim does not request to be present for hearings

Def in person & by Atty Gary R Schmaus.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Court orders $250.00 signature bond.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:15 am.
